assets.description:
Looking to stand out in a crowded marketplace IFC and GEICO turned to longtime partner Click 3X to create a co-branded vignette featuring Maxwell the Pig for season 3 of Portlandia. 
 
Written by Click 3X’s EP Rob Meyers and Directed by Creative Director Mark Szumski, this collaboration allowed Click access to create a Maxwell spot from concept through completion (which included all shoot, edit, and VFX) for the first time.
 
The result is a sidesplitting 30-second sketch that features Geico’s Maxwell the Pig mascot and references the show’s "Is It Local?" skit thatmocked the Pacific Northwest city's farm-to-table restaurant craze.
 
The ad is running during all 10 episodes of IFC’s Portlandia, which stars comic Fred Armisen and musician-turned-actress Carrie Brownstein.
assets.title: GEICO Portlandia

assets.title: Drone Teaser

assets.description:
The 2012 VMA’s begin at year zero. Year zero is the age of remixing, mashups, deconstructing, reconstructing, interactive gaming, transcending and transforming.  Welcome to a time where creativity and technology are within everyones reach and can change the world in a millisecond.  Welcome to the 2012 MTV Video Music Awards.

Our on-air image campaign for the 2012 MTV VMAs reflects this new ethos and embraces a world of transformative possibilities. Focusing on VMA talent to take us through this journey, we have created a :30 second image campaign that focused on what makes artists such as Pink, Taylor Swift, Alicia Keys, One Direction and Kanye West what they are.  With each individual spot, as we focus closely on the talent, visualizations deconstruct and reconstruct around them, as various different objects that represent core artistry, creative significance, animal spirit, as well as what the VMAs are all about - all the while changing and transforming to the beat of each artist's biggest, newest track.  And in a flash, it all sucks back and we find our stars on stage, tapping into these powers to transform into the artists that they are.

To achieve this, C3X teamed up with MTV Director Micah Perta and Creative Director Thomas Berger to board out the promo prior to the shoot, thus ensuring that we captured the proper essence.  Leading the charge for Click 3X was Creative Director Mark Szumski, Art Director Miguel Hernandez, and Editor Jeremy Baumann, who have overseen the VFX, design, and editorial components of the job, respectively.  Upon completion of the edit, animation and compositing was done both in After Effects and Flame to achieve the proper style and aesthetic.
assets.title: VMAs 2012

assets.description: Using provided live action green screen footage of Rihanna, which was directed by Melina Matoukas, we created animated backgrounds in After Effects and composited it all in Flame.
assets.title: Rihanna Rude Boy

assets.description:
LEGO reached out to us directly to create a series
of short films for a marketing tie-in with the Pirates of the Caribbean movie launch with Disney.

We created five character-animated mini movies loosely based off of the Pirates of the Caribbean movie, using characters and backgrounds made to look like they were made completely from LEGOs. The LEGO characters were created using Maya animation software, and composited the VFX in Flame. 

In addition to planned distribution, all of the LEGO character animated shorts were featured in the Pirates of the Caribbean Blu-Ray DVD.
assets.title: LEGO Pirates
